ranked_diseases.disease_name: Autoinflammatory disease, multisystem, with immune dysregulation, X-linked
ranked_diseases.explanation: The clinical presentation of chronic diarrhea and autoimmune hemolytic anemia aligns strongly with the symptoms seen in similar reference cases diagnosed with this condition.
Common variable immunodeficiency can present with chronic diarrhea and autoimmune hemolytic anemia due to immune dysregulation, although it is more commonly linked with recurrent infections.
Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome might present with autoimmune hemolytic anemia and gastrointestinal symptoms, including diarrhea, due to its immunological components.
This condition can include autoimmune manifestations like hemolytic anemia and features related to lymphoproliferation that might contribute to diarrhea or gastrointestinal symptoms.
